intro: Hieracium densiflorum subsp. saxonicum, commonly known as the Saxony hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically covered in dense, glandular hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
